description: Buy the 7 Protection Project .23 ABS Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Project .23 ABS Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the 7 Protection Project .23 ABS Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The helmet does what it's supposed to do.  The sizing it weird, I'm a large in every other helmet (7 1/4" fitted hat), but a medium in this one.  Overall it fits my head good, works great with my Smith Goggles, and thankfully haven't had to test out the crash rating.
review.name: Really good helmet

review.reviewBody:
after taking a decently spooky crash I decided to pony up for a full face.  I've taken crashes since and I feel like it's been nice but I haven't felt like it's prevented me from getting more hurt since the crashes were minor.  it is light and breathable which I love it's easy enough to pedal uphill.  it fits goggles or sunglasses in pretty easily and the brim provides good shade
.
For some reason, I get the feeling that this full face isn't quite as safe as other brands but I have no proof.
review.name: light weight but sturdy enough

review.reviewBody: This is a really good fit, light and good airflow.   I now feel I can let it rip a bit more on the DH runs!
review.name: Great Hat!

review.reviewBody: Fell on the first run, head first in the dirt.  As if nothing happened
review.name: Good size and effective

review.reviewBody:
In summary, this is a great helmet for the price range. I bought it because it offers good protection for the price as it is downhill certified to ASTM F1952 ? 15 standards.  Additionally, this helmet is really well ventilated. I have already used it on some Texas trails this summer, and it keeps me nice and cool here in the summer (as much as I can in the Texas heat). 

Buying Tips: BE SURE TO CHECK THE SIZING CHART on the manufacturer's website. In most helmets, I wear a size large. However, according to these sizings, I wear a size small. The sizing chart is correct because a size small fits me perfectly. 

Also BACKCOUNTRY, please update the IMPACT FOAM description of this product. I can confirm that this helmet does not use the "SERT (Seven Energy Reduction Technology)" as listed. After talking with the manufacturer, SERT is only available on the Fiberglass & Carbon versions of the helmet, not the ABS one here.
review.name: Great Helmet (esp. 4 warmer climates!)
comment:
have already used it on some Texas trails this summer, and it keeps me nice and cool.

MUCH APPRECIATED

review.reviewBody: I have not been out riding with this helmet to often but so far no problems. It is not as heavy as I expected it to be especially for the price. The head measurement worked out fine for me.
review.name: Great helmet for the price

name: Project .23 ABS Helmet

hasVariant.name: Crosshair Headset Cap

hasVariant.name: Crosshair Headset Cap
hasVariant.description: Buy the Deity Components Crosshair Headset Cap online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I needed a new stem spacer and decided to go with this kit to have a matching cap for just $10 more than the spacers alone.  Big mistake.  I installed the head cap to spec (4nm via torque wrench) and then needed to further adjust my alignment.  When I tried to take it back apart, the cheap bolt included with the cap easily stripped out.  I've spent the past few days figuring out how to get the stripped bolt out of my bike without ruining expensive components.  The cheap material used in the bolt kept wearing away and prevented removal.  I finally ended up hammering a large T30 Torx bit into the bolt, supergluing it all together, and successfully removed the stripped bolt.  The cap is now worn and trash.  The bolt was trash to begin with.  What an expensive 3m spacer I managed to purchase...

*To be clear, this kit came with two bolts.  A black one for installation and another color-matched one for looks.  The issues with the stripped bolt occurred with the black installation bolt.  I did not even try to use the color-matched aluminum bolt.
review.name: Cheap bolt, stripped at torque spec

name: Crosshair Headset Cap

review.itemreviewed: TX Hike Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love La Sportiva for knock around shoes and these are great looking as I expect from them.  I have noticed some of their other shoes are way too small, that is not the case with these, if anything they are a little big.  My biggest surprise is how light they are.  This does concern my about how rugged they are, but I love them so far.
review.name: Good Boot for Light Hiking

review.itemreviewed: TX Hike Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd pair and they have proven to be excellent under hot, cold, and wet conditions. The only reason for not giving 5 stars is that both pairs required supplemental insoles to provide adequate cushioning.
review.name: 2nd Pair and Probably not the Last

review.itemreviewed: TX Hike Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The sole on mine detached in one week. I was disappointed because I liked how it was comfortable. Hopefully they will fix the quality.
review.name: Comfortable but not durable

review.itemreviewed: TX Hike Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Supper light , so light there is nothing there , I feel every single little pebble I step on let alone little rocks that feel like someone is stabbing the bottom of your foot. The footbed also feels miss-shapped and digs in the edges of my foot causing foot fatigue after a couple hours. I have had several of La Sportiva boots and still have a pair that I where almost every day and Love them , be these are a huge fail,and unfortunately for me Backcountry would not take them back and give me store credit on an actual pair of boots, Very disappointing
review.name: Supper light

review.itemreviewed: TX Hike Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Had to return it, the sizing is not accurate. Much too small. I ordered the next half size up and it was still to small. Unfortunately a larger size isn't available :(.
review.name: Much too small

name: TX Hike Mid Leather GTX Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: These gloves are great quality and have all the features you want. My challenge is that I have fairly small hands and I nearly always use a small glove size (ring size 5-6). I ordered the medium and they were a bit tight the first ride (8 miles). The second ride (25 miles) I thought they would loosen up, but I had to take the right glove off at 23 miles because it was cutting into the web between my fingers so badly that my whole hand/arm was going numb. I wish I would've bought the large. Also, probably because of the size, they were EXTREMELY hard to get off. The "finger pulls" seem a little fragile and are hard to grab a hold of. I had to use my teeth to be able to grab onto them and pull.
review.name: Feature rich, run small on size

name: Calory Glove - Women's

hasVariant.name: Storable Pet Kennel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Stoic Storable Pet Kennel online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my 19 pound poodle on a trip last month. It is very sturdy and easy to use. The travel crate that I bought my 59 pound poodle ended up being terrible so I ordered another one of these for him too. It’s smaller than his every day crate at home but plenty big enough for him to still get up and move around.
review.name: Excellent travel crate

review.reviewBody: I thought this thing was going to pack down a lot smaller than it did given its reported 6 pound weight, this is actually closer to 12 pounds and fold up size is 28” x 24” x ~6”. The print is really cool, the zippers feel solid, and the windows are a nice touch. Still way too big and too heavy.
review.name: claimed weight is off by half

review.reviewBody:
Toaster Deluxo has enjoyed this home away from home. We conditioned him with it first with some positive reinforcement and then took it on the road. We appreciated the folding function and high quality internal structure. As a bonus, it fits perfectly under Marriott hotel desks. When it was time for Toast to take respite from his 10XL golden bear cousins, the kennel held tough and provided a sanctuary for the captain. The removable pad proved easy to clean and fast drying. Love the tent style window toggles and the many venting options. Great design overall, would buy again. 

"Howl on my friends!" - Capt. Toast
review.name: Robust little crate.

review.reviewBody: Only just received it, set it up. Quality appears quite nice so far. Heavier than I expected. But that’s the really solid frame! It’s an accordion style stretch. Locks in. I did have to turn the frame around, as the cross bar in the back was across the side with the screen. But that was super easy to do. My dog walked right in and claimed it right away! So far, so happy. Did I mention cute print?
review.name: Seems like nice quality. Love the print

name: Storable Pet Kennel

review.reviewBody: The sleeves were the perfect length for ice climbing or other activities where your arms are extended overhead. But the sleeves were about an inch too long when my arms were at my side around camp or in town. Then I discovered that the construction of the cuffs, and shape of the velcro on the cuffs is perfect for folding the cuff back on itself one inch.  The fold is held in place by setting the velcro to create a curve that matches your wrist when the sleeve is rolled back once. It's a beautiful and simple design that effectively makes the sleeves adjustable length. I am 6' tall, 157 pounds. A size Medium fits me perfect.
review.name: Designed to Fold Cuffs Back

review.reviewBody: I actually got the 3.0 version. This jacket is awesome!!! Extremely well made and very durable so far! Waterproofing is spot on! Love HH products! They never let me down!
review.name: What a jacket!

description: Buy the Black Diamond Dawn Patrol 15L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dawn Patrol 15L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Dawn Patrol 15L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This bag has a different layout from the 25 l and 32 l variations but it works really well. Rather than having two main compartments and the the front access it splits one large compartment into two zones. The pockets accommodate avalanche gear, a couple of other small items, and hydration. This is not your bring everything bag. The small and large sizes are quite different so check the measurements and make sure you get the right one for you. I love the way that this bag's cargo area is shallow and stays very close to your body. It is definitely a great bag for skiing or other activities where you are moving a lot and need the load to remain secure.
review.name: Great for Resort Skiing

review.reviewBody: Can’t wait until the lifts start turning to try it out.
review.name: As described

review.reviewBody: I had an old model of this pack and when I lost it I was devastated. I was very happy to get a new version of it. And it stands up to BD quality and design. It's amazing, clean access, the pockets are a great size. Perfect for lift served or light jaunts outside the gates.
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody: Another solid BD pack, I have numerous of varying capacities. It's my minimal, lightweight pack for the resort, side-country and quicker tours. Doesn't feel like you're wearing a pack when on, don't notice it when riding a lift except when carrying a shovel. Only complaint is that I wish the hip belt was removable for times I don't want or need it clipped but that is solvable but clipping and cinching it on the other side of the pack. Overall meets my needs, glad I purchased.
review.name: Great Smaller Pack

review.reviewBody: My only complaint is on the front of the pack, the excess strapping is longer and wish there was a way to wrap it and conceal it. Not a big deal but when you're going down the meowtain you have what look like tassels flying around. I'm going to pick up some black rubbing bands and just tie them up.
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: Got this pack for boarding and it works great. Adjustable straps and waist belt are very comfortable and keep the pack secure. It's a great minimalist size so you don't over pack and affect your weight distribution.
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody: Everything seems to be of very high quality and well thought out. I am excited to use it this season!
review.name: Great Backpack

review.reviewBody: I bought this to replace an older avylung pack of slightly larger volume and considerably more heft. Superb BD build quality and just enough space and organization for a shovel and probe to be kept separate from other gear. I would like the ability to entirely remove the waist belt for lift riding (sternum strap is sufficient to control the load), and a shoulder strap mounted drawstring pocket for a small (8oz) waterbottle or two way radio, both of which I regularly use for resort skinning and riding
review.name: Good compact inbounds and sidebounds pack

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack for those times I just need to carry a few things and didn't want anything bigger. For that purpose the pack is perfect. With the small size and it's fit I don't even notice I'm carrying it. Looking forward to this being my go to pack to carry a few extra clothes and some snacks on winter adventures.
review.name: Perfect small pack.

review.reviewBody: Great fitting pack, a great size and fit for any snow or hiking adventure. Love all the pockets and other conveniences along with it. Very durable.
review.name: Dawn pack

name: Dawn Patrol 15L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I just received the Neutrino 600 sleeping bag and I'm very disappointed. 1st of all my whole order is not here and the rest of my may be in the sleeping bag sack but I wouldn't know because I can't open it because some knucklehead pulled the zipper over the outer flaps so it can't be opened. I will be returning this unfortunately it was supposed to be gift and I have to begin traveling so I don't know that I'll be able to resolve this issue before my daughter's birthday. review.reviewBody: Gloves fit well, slight rubbing between the index finger and thumb, more padding on the metatarsal, overall fine.
review.name: Ok

review.reviewBody: I keep buying these because they fit well (although they run small and I need an XXL) and they are pretty comfortable. But the durability is nil. They last me a. Few.onyjs,amd that's even with rotating the colors. The colors fad badly, and the material breaks down. You can do better, Pearl Izumi.
review.name: Low quality

review.reviewBody: This version of the ELITE Glove is a downgrade from the previous model.  First off, sizing has definitely changed.  I comfortably wear a Small in my multiple pairs of the old ELITE Glove- while the Small of these is much more tight.  Also the wrist opening is much more narrow- even after sizing up to a Medium- so much so you can't even fully close the velcro.  Padding wise, they're ok- but I think my previous ones are more comfortable.  Honestly not sure what Pearl Izumi was thinking here.
review.name: Downgrade

review.reviewBody: Initially, I liked these gloves. The padding is OK. However, the color fades rapidly, and the velcro loses its stick. These weren't meant to last more than a few months.
review.name: Not built to last

review.reviewBody:
These gloves have just the right amount of gel padding to mute the vibration from the bars. They fit snugly but are comfortable.
2 pull rings make removal easier.
review.name: Fits like cycling gloves should.

review.reviewBody: Really poor quality. First, this is the smallest and most non-operational velcro closure I've ever used. It barely reaches across the wrist. After little use the velcro starts pulling away from the flap that it is sewn onto. My gloves were red for maybe 5 washes. Now they look pink - major color fade. I'm a lifelong PI fan. It's like these were made by a completely different company, that doesn't understand how cycling gloves need to work and also doesn't understand style. Total betrayal of previous PI standards. I wonder where they were made - I have some guesses.
review.name: Velcro doesn't work; color fades

review.reviewBody: I ride rode bike and use the hoods on brakes a lot for my hand position and there is no padding there. quality is good . Good buy on sale
review.name: Not Bad

review.reviewBody: I regularly use PI gloves, but this pair has a strange fit. The hand portion is about right, but the wrist opening is very small. The velcro strap barely reaches the mating portion, and I do not have large wrists. These are not usable and will be returned.
review.name: Odd fit

review.reviewBody: I've had PI gloves for years. These are the worst quality I've ever had. The padding is very thin. The wrist straps are very flimsy. If it wasn't backcountry, I would think they were counterfeits. Very disappointed.
review.name: Low quality

name: ELITE Gel Glove  - Men's

review.reviewBody: Wear them for fishing and hanging out around the dock. The soles pick up Little Rock’s which is my reason for going bing them 4 seconds ars vs 5.
review.name: I like the boots

review.reviewBody: These boots  have been  keeping my feet warm and dry on my farm in Minnesota  this winter.
review.name: Great winter farm boot
comment:
Hi Mike,
That is great to hear.  thanks so much for the 5 star review!

review.reviewBody: I love them boots! The best pair of boots I ever had
review.name: Great boots! Highly recommended

review.reviewBody: Super high quality, comfortable and great value.  Highly recommend
review.name: Awesome boot

review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable boots I have owned. The neoprene upper doesn't chafe my calves and keeps my feet warm and dry.
review.name: Comfy and warm

review.reviewBody: A great boot, so far! I've hiked for several hours at a time in them, and they stay comfortable, warm and dry. They're as comfy as my slippers. But way more waterproof.
review.name: Dry and comfy

review.reviewBody: With a wool insert and heavy wool socks my feet stay warm and dry fishing all season long, while they work ok for ice fishing and in the snow they just are not made for that. However fishing 60-70 miles offshore in the great north east during the winter months these are thee boots. Only gripe about this brand is that you can’t bend the toe to much or the sole will separate from them. Only improvements they need would be to stitch the sole to the boot itself to avoid the separation. Other than that it’s great boot I’ve fished them hard for 3 seasons and have just had to apply a small amount shoe glue thus far. Still waterproof.
review.name: Warm and reliable

review.reviewBody: Compared to muck boots, these boots last easily 3 times longer. I clean porta potties for a living, and these boots take all the abuse I put them through on a daily basis. I rarely slip thanks to the mean tread pattern. All around amazing boots.
review.name: Best boot you'll ever wear
comment: Hello Ryan and thank you for providing us your review. We are happy to hear your kids are satisfied with the boots you purchased them. We hope you all continue to be Xtratuf supporters!

review.reviewBody: Just got these very expensive for a boot. I like the fit. Lighter than my grudens. Great traction, breathable in 30 degree weather but keep your feet and shins warm. Did get moist running trawls but over all woukd buy again. Will do another review in 4 months to show how they wear out.
review.name: Just got a Pair
comment: Hello Alex and thank you for providing your review. We are happy to hear you are satisfied with the boot you ordered, and we hope you continue to be an XTRATUF supporter!

review.reviewBody:
Been hunting and fishing in AK for the past 20 years in nothing but the OG boots so I thought I'd give these a try-
Pros: wider toe box and overall more secure fit than the OG, decent insulation for winter
Cons: Less mobility- feels more like stomping around in a ski boot bc you can't point your toes as much. This is okay for being on a boat but not so good for hunting.

Overall still as comfortable and reliable as all Xtratufs. I'll probably stick with these bc I have wider feet and the regular insulated boots are too narrow. Would also highly recommend putting in some sort of supportive insert- lots of Alaskans do and it makes a BIG difference in comfort.
review.name: Solid boot, good for wide feet

name: Elite Legacy 15in Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: After a couple months indoor and few outdoor rides I'm ready to declare this saddle a winner. At first the shape put different pressure which took a little getting used to but after that it has been great. The rise in the rear of the saddle is noticeable in the force you can put down more easily. It gives your gluts something to 'push against' when putting the power on. I didn't think the dipped nose would matter but I see the wisdom in that as well, in not snagging your shorts/leg and slightly relieving pressure on the soft tissue. Only negative is that I feel the ridge along the cutout is overly hard. It would be better if this sloped in toward the cutout or was a bit softer. But still give this 5-stars!
review.name: Great saddle, shape gives it an edge

review.reviewBody: I've tried probably close to a dozen saddles in my life and none of them ever seemed quite right. As luck would have it I ended up stumbling on this saddle and now I'll never buy another! My main problems with most saddles are that I end up going numb after 20 or 30 miles and when I say numb, I mean numb in all the extremities, which as most cyclists know isn't a fun experience. Well, first ride on this and I didn't have any numbness. I thought maybe it was because it was only about 20 miles so I took it on its first century the next weekend. Turns out after trying new shoes, new chamois, new gloves and everything in-between, it was my saddle causing all the problems! While the shape may look a little goofy to some, it's the key to what makes this so perfect. I'm so happy and finally and most importantly, I'm the most comfortable I've ever been on a bike. :)
review.name: Done Looking for the Right Saddle
comment: Nice review, thanks Dustin.

name: Drakon Saddle

review.reviewBody: Just what I wanted a bag that holds up to extreme conditions!
Large and in charge. Plenty big enough for a week long trip worth of clothing. Solid. Well built. Definitely like it a lot!
review.name: Dry Creek Duffle 200L

review.reviewBody: Perfect for multi-day floats, fly-in trips, or strapping to the back of my adventure bike hunting for un-fished pools. I’m never surprised by Simms legendary quality but have to admit I wasn’t expecting just how useful and well-thought-out this bag would be!
review.name: My new go-to

review.reviewBody: Best travel bag ever. Super light,strong, and dry!

Big bag , big disappointment! I have utilized this bag for years and had the welded seams blow out rendering it useless. My local shoe repair shop can not repair it and I am not sure if I should replace it with a new model and have the same issue in a few years? It has served me well but just didn’t hold up very long
review.name: Big dis

review.reviewBody: Great bag, fits so much. Great for your fishing/camping trips where you can put everything you need in it; waders, boots, flyrod case, cloths, fishing equipment. It takes it all.
review.name: Last travel fishing bag you’ll ever need

review.reviewBody: So nice to have piece of mind my gear will be dry, even after several days of substantial rain in a row.  Dependable and durable.
review.name: Dependable and Durable

review.reviewBody: Lg. enough to hold all of my guide equipment(1st aid, rescue equipment, tackle) and a real dry bag to keep all dry for weeks at a time. Excellent bag.

perfect size for my day use bag on someone else's boat.
Easy to open, stays open when needed. Very industrial strength, should hold up well

Since it is winter here I will not be able to use them ( dry creek duffel bags )for months . So I looked them over very thoroughly and not only are they well made but they will be perfect for the float plane and just right for our rafting trips .

name: Dry Creek 60-200L Duffel

review.reviewBody:
Have had these for 3 years and they are the best rain boot for ebike riding.  

Nice flat sole that works well with flat pedals
Good insole for walking
12" height is good for keeping rain out of ankles...I tried the short ones but water would go over them at speed.
review.name: The best rain ebike boot

review.reviewBody: The upper cusp team should be double double stitch or heavier gauge stitching.
review.name: Like em

review.reviewBody:
After 3 weeks of daily wear, the inner lining wore away across the back of my heel. Now, walking for more than ~20 minutes causes severe blisters due to the unprotected rubber. I have experimented with a few different types of socks and all have the same issue. I would not recommend if you do actual work. Probably fine to wear around town.
The boot has remained waterproof, which is a plus. That being said, it is not worth the discomfort. I have never received blisters from any other item of footwear in my life.
review.name: Good waterproofing, not durable.

review.reviewBody: So far so good. Not sure if they will last as long as the XtraTuffs do, but they are definitely  more comfortable in my opinion. The traction is not quite as good either, but for sport fishing they are the way to go. Feels like you are wearing a tennis shoe on deck even 12+ hours later.
review.name: More comfortable than the "gold standard"

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] They fit nicely around my feet and under my bib. Couldn't ask for better. Especially for the price.
review.name: Thank you very much!

review.reviewBody: Awesome boots! Wore them all day, 4 days straight and they didn't let me down. Very comfortable.
review.name: My goto for crabbing.

review.reviewBody:
Fit great, feel great.
I'm using my boots for trout fishing in GA.
Perfect for shallow streams.
review.name: Looks great, feels great

review.reviewBody: To me they are oversized. I typically I wear a 10 in tennis shoes and other boots. I even called and talked with someone to ask if they were oversized  and was told no. I Unfortuantley threw everything away before I wore them much so that is on me. I would good down a size moving forward but might go a different direction.
review.name: Too big

review.reviewBody: Just love these boots! Easy on and off and very comfortable
review.name: Will order again!

review.reviewBody: It was a gift and it was a huge success.  Just what they wanted!
review.name: GREAT gift!

name: 12in Deck Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent pizza oven! We use it multiple times a week and the results are amazing. It heats up fast, keeps heat well even for cooking 3+ pizzas in close succession. The size is great for larger or multiple pizzas and an evenly cooked crust.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very nice and well designed.
The shelves should be solid instead of the wire rack type, also there should be a dedicated area for a propane tank.
review.name: Very nice and well designed.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very solid and spacious table to hold my Katy Pro 2. Would be great to have a way to incorporate space for a propane tank and the bottom shelf moved just a few inches higher off the ground for when it’s covered. The cover is a skosh too short with the 16in Kari Pro2 on top leaving the shelf and peels etc right below the bottom edge of the cover.
review.name: Very solid and spacious

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the oven. I feel I can improve the recipes but love the oven
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The bottom shelf should be slightly lower or the second shelf should be slightly higher to accommodate a gas tank.
review.name: Tim table

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Easy assembly. Very sturdy. Casters that actually work! Adding the large cover was a great move. The height matches to use. Thank you Ooni!
review.name: The multi-use table I didn’t expect!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Easy to put together, solid, perfect size for me. As attractive as a metal utility table can be —I use it for a volt indoors in my home office because of no room on our kitchen counters —have to open windows and put fan on high to avoid setting off fire alarms
—winter will be chilly but it works
review.name: Just what I needed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect for indoor. Did not want to use the pizza oven on my Court counters. Great storage space as well.
review.name: Perfect for indoor. Did not

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Casters are durable and it the perfect size for the Koda 16. The materials are quality and this table will last a lifetime.
review.name: Modular table

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I like that Ooni is a Scottish brand, but the cost of these tables is somewhat of a hard pill to swallow. It's box steel, coated, with a stainless top. It's made in China. It's an ok trolley sure, but I can't understand a) why it can't be made locally b) be made cheaper. If it can't be made cheaper then surely it can be made locally. But hey, sign of the times
review.name: Expensive for what it is.

name: Modular Table

review.reviewBody:
I still may go with flats depending on the ride, but I've gone full-time (mostly) clipless because of these shoes. I could never get the right foot position and feel with other clipless shoes but the ability to slam the cleats back a little farther on these is all I needed. These put me the most confident descending position, and climbing too. 

I've paired these with long spindle Mallet-E pedals (with the pins run a little higher than how they ship) and the easy release, 6deg float cleats.

I disagree on the size recommendation. I wear 11.5 shoes across the board (vans, nike) and the 11.5 in these is pretty spot on if not a touch on the small side. Not enough to size up.

I swapped out the quick lace for traditional laces. I like to keep the forefoot area as loose and roomy as possible and that's harder to dial in with the quicklace or boa system since those are all about even tension/pressure. 

Flats are for sure more comfortable, but these are a close second when it comes to walking around.
review.name: Sold me on going clipless

review.reviewBody: These shoes fit great, the heel hold is stellar and comfort is great. I have only been riding these on the trainer thus far, but the break in was pretty easy and painless. Cleat pocket mates up perfectly with all CB pedals. I am a true 8, and the size 8 was a hair big on me. I would say size down a .5 size if you are looking for a performance fit.
review.name: Great Fit

name: Mallet Speedlace Mountain Bike Shoe

review.reviewBody: I purchased my first pair of HOKA's in 2022 - a Mach 5. I absolutely LOVED this shoe. It fit like a glove, felt like a cloud, and was so comfortable for running and walking. Over the course of 1-2 years, I walked and ran hundreds, if not thousands of miles in my Mach 5's. Unfortunately, the time had come for a new pair, but Mach 5's were being phased out. I figured a Mach 6 would not be terribly different. Well, I was wrong. While the shoe has a nice aesthetic look, I noticed that A) the shoe felt a lot tighter on my foot than the Mach 5 and B) after a couple weeks the toe tip started to feel very hard/rigid. I reached out to HOKA Customer Support and filed a warranty claim, requesting a replacement pair thinking it was a one-off issue. Upon receiving the new pair and wearing them a couple of weeks, I realized the issue prevailed, and it was clear that the issue was this shoe model. To go from having a shoe I absolutely loved to a newer model of the same shoe and being severely let down was not the best experience. I ended up filing another warranty claim and was issued a refund. There might be another HOKA model out there I will like as much as the Mach 5's, but the Mach 6's was not it.
review.name: A Downgrade from the Mach 5

review.reviewBody: Although I am a long time runner, this is my first Hoka and it is well worth the money. Great bounce and cushion. I have worn it for ~100 miles so far and it is going great. Feels a bit squishy in the first couple of runs because of all the cushion until you get used to the feeling. A note on sizing - I usually wear Brooks Ghost size 11D (0.5 bigger than my regular size). The recommended size was 10.5 on the site while purchasing. Turns out that size was small, I could feel the toes sticking out during a 6 miler. I exchanged them for 11, and they are perfect. Done a couple of 20 milers in them without problem. I intend the wear them during a marathon in a few weeks.
review.name: Great running shoes

review.reviewBody: I've only run about 20km in these so far but they feel great and I'm enjoying them. I bought these and a pair of Skyflows at the same time. The Skyflows felt a little narrow at first (they've loosened up a bit so it's not an issue). The Mach 6's did not. They've felt good right from the start. Fits true to size and there's a reasonable amount of room in the toe-box. I'm looking forward to using these.
review.name: Early days, but I really like these

review.reviewBody: I would call these shoes black / grey vs. black on black.. I purchased for refereeing basketball and was disappointed that it wasn't truly black/black. While the photos on the site did have some color variance the shoes were much more drastic in the color difference.
review.name: Black / Charcoal Grey

review.reviewBody: I bought a pair about 3 months ago at a running shoe store because they felt good on the treadmill and were at a good price. Upon first putting them on they initially felt better than any other shoe I'd tried. After a week of running about 4 miles a day, I started to have issues. The front is designed horribly and uses terrible materials. As a result, I've taken my socks off to find my toes bloody because of how bad they are. They might seem to have good energy return, but after some use you notice how little support they really give.
review.name: DO NOT BUY THIS SHOE

review.reviewBody: I had to return my first ones to get a half size up and wider. My on cloud shoes are good and these are very competitive with them. I'll eventually get another HOKA pair.
review.name: Good quality shoes

review.reviewBody: I love the feel of the Mach 6 when first worn out of the box with one big exception...It is a bit narrow in a size D and is a bit more narrow than the Mach 5. That being said, it is a very bouncy, energetic shoe for about 100 miles. After that, the rocker becomes less pronounced, and the bouncy feeling in the mid-sole declines. Could be Hoka's best shoe if they can correct the "narrow fit" and add some life to the shoe.
review.name: Runs Flat By 100 Miles.

review.reviewBody: Super light and responsive. Provides ample support, also. Color schemes are ALL rad!!
review.name: Best running shoes I've ever owned

review.reviewBody: My first pair of Mach 6 (and legacy Mach 5) were amazing. I run nearly every day from 2 milers to 50Ks and have loved the Mach 6. I gave this a 3 because I know the shoe is great but my recent purchase was a bad shoe. The tongue is broken (it's ripped) and I've only put 10 miles on the shoe so I'm disappointed.
review.name: Second pair of Mach 6

review.reviewBody: If you have been running for the last few years in Mach 5's, be aware that the Mach 6 is a very different shoe. It is significantly "bouncier" and the rocking feature has been exaggerated further over that of the Mach 5. They are are still great shoes, but I definitely recommend running in them before making your purchase (I just did a quick slip on for sizing). I am sure I would have tried some of the other neutral road running shoes before buying these,
review.name: Big change from Mach 5...

name: Mach 6 Running Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the MSR Pika 1L Teapot online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pika 1L Teapot
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Pika 1L Teapot online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Lightweight and boils water fast. Cools down fast too. I used mine for 5 days and 5 nights on the Kalalau Trail. It was perfect for my needs. Boil water for freeze dried foods.
review.name: Light weight travel companions

review.reviewBody:
I love this pot, but I'm not happy with the plastic lid. I lit the wrong burner and there wasn't enough water left in this kettle, and by the time I noticed what happened the lid had completely melted and was sending plastic smoke into the air. It was totally my fault and I was going to replace this, but I still feel a little sick so I'm nervous about whatever chemicals they used to produce the lid. Plastic has no business anywhere near a hot surface.
Unrelated to this screw up, the handle gets screaming hot so you need hold it with a towel, which gets kind of annoying.
review.name: Stop Using Plastic

review.reviewBody: I love this pot. It's light, the handle is well designed, it makes it much easier to handle boiling water for drinks and rehydrating food.
review.name: I love this pot. It's

review.reviewBody:
Correct size for preparing generously sized meal portions for one plus a cup of coffee for breakfast. 

Easy to handle without pot holders and a great pour spout
review.name: Correct size for preparing generously

review.reviewBody: I love this cute little teapot, but I wish it were a little bigger. There is not quite enough water for 2 bowl of oatmeal and 2 cups of tea/coffee. If you fill it very full it has a tendency to boil over out the spout and douse the stove. This is perfect for solo use or just tea, etc. Not quite big enough for two people. A 1.2L pot would probably be perfect foe us.
review.name: Excellent, but too small

review.reviewBody:
I am full time work/fun living out of my small travel trailer. The Pika is practical, small and light and I dig the style (style points count for something)
I haven't used it a ton yet but its a nice durable but light construction like other MSR products I have used.
review.name: Sweet

review.reviewBody: THIS TEAPOT LID IS MAKE OF PLASTIC ! THE SIZE IS SO SMALL, IT IS GOOD FOR BACK PACKING, JUST ENOUGH HOT WATER FOR MYSELF TO DRINK, THE TEAPOT HAVE NO PACKING  ITSELF,  IT WAS DENTED FROM SHIPPING.
review.name: ITEM DAMAGED

review.reviewBody: Perfect size pot for my solo adventures. Well made handle and I like that the lid stays on while I am pouring the hot water.
review.name: Perfect size pot for my

review.reviewBody: Surprised at how much I like this teapot. The wider base and shorter height means I don't worry about it tipping over. The handle stays up in position and doesn't get hot so I can lift it easily without reaching for a rag. With the 'clear' lid, you can see what's going on inside; though, that being said, I know when the water is ready by the amount of steam coming out of the spout. And that spout! It's perfect for my needs. Consistent pour (I can count the ounces I need as I'm pouring and it's always the same); and, no dripping! I actually take both this teapot and my 550ml cup so I can boil enough water for my freeze dried meal and have enough water for a cup of coffee, and still be able to boil more water in the teapot for other purposes. I store my fuel canister in my 550ml cup and put my Pocket Rocket Deluxe in the teapot along with a lighter and a small clean-up wrap. A bag would be nice, but I use a mesh fruit bag which is lighter than the bag that came with my cup. I originally wanted measuring marks, but find it unnecessary since (as I said), the pour is so consistent, it's unnecessary. Very pleased with my purchase.
review.name: Love this little teapot!

review.reviewBody: I use this kettle regularly. It’s extremely enjoyable and performs well, especially for the price. I particularly like the sturdy handle. However, as has been said, it would be great if the opening were big enough for a small gas canister as well. Then it would be the perfect self contained brew kit.
review.name: Great Product

name: Pika 1L Teapot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These socks are great for hunting. They keep your feet cozy when you're doing your best imitation of a bump on a log in below-freezing weather.
review.name: Thick, cushy socks!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This will be a layering sock. The outer layer to be specific. It's quite large for the sizing. However it is very soft and warm. Can't wait to try it out
review.name: Comfy and warm but big and too stretchy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These socks have kept my feet warm in the cold Alaskan winter between -10 and 10 degrees. The only problem was the shape of the socks, the front part of the sock was a bit big.
review.name: Keeps feet warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought these to take on a trekking trip to Nepal. Treated them out beforehand and they are so cushy in my boots and will totally do the trick to keep my feet warm.
review.name: Toasty warm

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Needed two pair of good socks in a hurry. I ordered the heavy/expensive pairs and paid for overnight shipping. Received one pair. Asked them to send the other pair and they said, yeah, no. Sorry...
review.name: Disappointed in the company, not the socks.

review.reviewBody: Just received them. I wear size 5.5 shoes and ordered the small. They wrap around my feet like a cloudy embrace, as if my feet were baby birds within a wool-filled nest. I have large calves but the fabric doesn?t pinch at all. Can?t wait to try these out in my waders!
review.name: Feels so cushy!

name: Mountaineer Mid Calf Sock - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Garmin Rally XC Dual-Sided Power Meter Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Rally XC Dual-Sided Power Meter Pedals
review.reviewBody:
I've been using them with a Garmin 1030 head unit and everything has gone smoothly.

They show up within a second or two of turning on the Garmin and I'm asked to hit the calibrate button. A few seconds later, it's ready to go. I feel like the connectivity is a little less fussy than the Stages crank arms I've used before. And I do like that if I upgrade my bike, I can just move these pedals over to the new bike in a few minutes.

As far as how they perform as pedals... I guess I'm not that picky? You clip in, they go around... what's not to like?
review.name: Great pedals!

review.itemreviewed: Rally XC Dual-Sided Power Meter Pedals
review.reviewBody: I've had these pedals for a couple of years now.  I've replaced the batteries once, and overall have no complaints.  They're accurate, reliable, and durable.  The only issue I ran into is that the profile is a little larger than a regular XC SPD pedal, on my MTB, I have had some pedal strikes due to the larger profile.  Though, after getting used to them, it was able to be corrected through improved technique.  If nothing else this did help me feel confident in their durability.
review.name: Excellent pedals

review.itemreviewed: Rally XC Dual-Sided Power Meter Pedals
review.reviewBody: Been riding these well over a year now.  Put them on my mountain bike so I could compare workouts with my road bike.  They have been foolproof.  I have changed the batteries once in since I have owned them.  They sync right up with my Wahoo Roam computer once I have started the ride.  Sometimes it takes a minute, but it syncs.
review.name: Love these Pedals

name: Rally XC Dual-Sided Power Meter Pedals

review.reviewBody: It fits great (I'm 5'2" and 105 lbs. and got size s). It is really good for layering.
review.name: I like it

review.reviewBody: The jacket was super thin; and as an online only store you have a so-called size chart which apparently the measurements are incorrect and then you punish people for needing to change the size or trying a different model by putting the return shipping label burden on their shoulder. Maybe learn a little bit from other companies; I had been a Black Diamond customer for 14 years but will never buy your products even for free.
review.name: Too thin; sizing chart incorrect

review.reviewBody: Super warm and light weight. I'm very happy with this jacket. However, sleeves are too long for me and they are not adjustable. Otherwise fits great.
review.name: Good

review.reviewBody: The jacket has been great. The weight is perfect for a second layer while out ski touring. It has protection from the elements yet not too warm. Sizing was a little tricky as I ordered a medium but probably should have gotten a small. Medium is a little on the larger size but fits well over an insulating layer. I'm 5.5" and weigh 128 lbs.
review.name: The jacket has been great.

review.reviewBody: Love the Azurite color. The jacket is nice and roomy to wear a layer underneath. It's a great hybrid jacket for the in between seasons.
review.name: Great hoody

review.reviewBody: Love this hoody! Fits nicely and is just the right weight for the chill mornings.
review.name: Great hoody!

review.reviewBody:
I greatly appreciate you guys supporting nurses during these unprecedented times. 
I look forward to my adventures this jacket awaits!
review.name: Thanks for the nurse discount!

name: Element Hooded Fleece Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Caribou X WP Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: The boots were really cute and an accurate fit everywhere but the ankle. One wear of these boots left me with cuts and scars on my ankles. Unfortunately, regardless of this issue, if any of Sorel’s shoes cause issues, you cannot obtain a refund even if you’ve worn them only once.
review.name: Causes cuts at ankle
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Caribou X WP Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: beautiful shoes but i wear a size 11, i couldnot get my foot through the small ankle hole. Terrible design for big feet, they need a zipper or something so you can get your foot in.
review.name: not good for large feet
comment: Hello D, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry CARIBOU™ X Women's Chelsea Waterproof Boot didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.itemreviewed: Caribou X WP Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: So comfortable and stylish and perfect for the rain!
review.name: Love it !

review.itemreviewed: Caribou X WP Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: These boots are INCREDIBLE. They are so comfortable and they look so cute with so many different looks. Absolutely love them!
review.name: Buy these now!

review.itemreviewed: Caribou X WP Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Theses boots are the best! True to size. They’re cute, comfortable, and practical. They look great with Jeans, leggings or anything really!
review.name: Best boots!

review.itemreviewed: Caribou X WP Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I received these boots as a gift and they are perfect for what I need them for. Super stylish with the black leather and gum sole. The upper part is stiff at first but after 4-5 wears they are starting to loosen. I have worn them in icy, snow  conditions in alaska and they have pretty good grip. I have not worn them for long periods of time in below freezing temperatures yet but they keep my feet warm when I’m out and about, and in and out of the cold between errands. I’m considering other colors because I love them so much.
review.name: Stylish, True to size and great grip in snowy conditions

review.itemreviewed: Caribou X WP Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: They are wider inside than they look, so that made me happy. Super comfy, and waterproof. I stepped in a puddle that cover the whole bottom and my feet were totally dry. A great investment pair
review.name: BEST INVESTMENT

review.itemreviewed: Caribou X WP Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the color and shape of the boots. But it's tough to get in. I don't have a wide foot; the entrance is tight. I had to return it.
review.name: Beautiful boots but hard to getting in.

review.itemreviewed: Caribou X WP Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm usually a 7.5/8. Size 8 felt too big. Size 7.5 too small. These boots were so hard to get on, and then rubbed in all the wrong places. Incredibly uncomfortable, which is a shame because they are so cute. Sorel also doesn't pay for return labels so trying on two different sizes means I lost money on these returns.
review.name: A let down
comment: Hello kmarie, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's Caribou™ X Boot Chelsea is hard to size. We’re happy to help rectify the issue if you will reach out to our support team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Caribou X WP Chelsea Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: If you have high arches and/or a high instep, you may want to look elsewhere. The boots are beautiful but I could not get my foot into them, even with a shoehorn and thin socks. I had to return them.
review.name: Beautiful boots but couldn't even get them on
comment: Hello SD, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's Caribou™ X Boot Chelsea is hard to size. We’re happy to help rectify the issue if you will reach out to our support team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

name: Caribou X WP Chelsea Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this for a few years and it’s put up with lots of abuse. I love how easy it is to set up and break down. It’s super thin so it fits anywhere in the car or in the ski box on top of the car. Never leave without it and it lets me pick any camp spot that doesn’t have a fire ring so more seclusion in the desert for me. description: Buy the Squirt Lube Chain Lube online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chain Lube
hasVariant.description: Buy the Squirt Lube Chain Lube online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've been using this on my MTB and gravel bikes for the last 2 years. So much better than others I've ran before. Does well on dirty and wet days - unlike others... Make the switch if you haven't. But also make sure to clean your chain before each application...
review.name: THE BEST FOR OFF-ROAD

review.reviewBody:
This lube is phenomenal. I ride a lot of sandy and muddy trails in florida, and other lines wet and dry pick up all that crud and turn my drivetrain black and nasty. No such problems with this wax lube. Apply to a clean drivetrain and let it sit overnight to dry, and it stays clean a long time and keeps things nice and quiet. Nothing sticks to it because it's essentially dry wax once the water in it evaporates, so you won't have all the trail crud getting sucked into your chain and gears and turning to liquid sand paper. It will also help your drivetrain last a lot longer because of this feature.

I've gone through 3 bottles so far with no issues no matter the conditions. 10/10 recommend!
review.name: Fantastic Lube, Keeps my Bike Clean

review.reviewBody:
Squirt was really trendy when it came out years ago. Now there's lots of liquid-wax style lubes like it, but this is still my go-to! I prefer it off road, where a lot of dust and dirt can accumulate on my chain. The dirt does not stick around and gunk up your drivetrain if you use Squirt. With a bit of water and soap all the grime rinses right off, too! Don't degrease or you'll ruin the wax layer you've built up. Its not the all-time best at straight-up lubricating, so I find myself re-applying ever 50ish miles, or after a big ride.

On road, I find that it accumulates a different, greasier kind of dirt. I prefer regular lube that I can degrease regularly for that use. I would NOT use this on a bike that you plan to both use on a trainer and ride outdoors. You'll notice that darker, hardened grease accumulating nearby as it flies off your cassette.

PRO TIP: Squirt is thick stuff. Heat it in a mug of water just off the boil. Bonus points for preheating your chain with a hairdryer so it all sinks in. Let the product dry completely before riding.
review.name: My off road lube of choice

name: Chain Lube

review.reviewBody: I purchased these as Easter gifts for the entire family and I think these might be some of the best gifts I've ever given. ExOfficio's bug guard (permethrin 0.52%) leaves a light scent on the bandana (99.48%) at first but it is not irritating to those with sensitive skin. We tested it out along the river bank where bugs had just been parading our faces. Although this doesn't work for bees (no sweat, they kept their stingers to themselves).. all the other bugs that were previously bothering us were gone as soon as we put the bandanas around our necks! It was amazing to see these work in live action!! I can't wait to wear these on EVERY adventure ahead. Must have, great investment!
review.name: BANK FOR YOUR BUCK BANDANA

review.reviewBody: I like this bandana well mad and comfortable around the neck.
review.name: Well made!

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Traction Mule V Bootie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Too small, opening too tight, and toe box too narrow. I was disappointed. Poor design.
review.name: these did not work for me

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Traction Mule V Bootie - Men's
review.reviewBody: I keep coming back to these, in men's and women's, and the higher ankle booties as well. I DO not use as slippers and wear them out all the time. I'm a shoe collector and when they go on sale stock up. Super cute, warm and aoo comfortable.
review.name: I own most colors!!

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Traction Mule V Bootie - Men's
review.reviewBody: I started out using these just to take my dog for his morning 20-30min walk before the sun comes up. They are great for that when the weather is cold. I would leave them by the door and them eventually started wearing them for when I would take my dog for his longer afternoon and evening walks (3hrs total). When I started doing that, I noticed my feet began to hurt really bad in the heel and arches. Nothing had changed other than wearing these instead of my AirMax walking shoes. That is the only reason one star comes off. They look great, feel good (for short distances lol), durable, water resistant, easy to get on/off, and at a very reasonable price point.
review.name: Great for SHORT walks/wears

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Traction Mule V Bootie - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these and third pair of TNF slipper line. Very comfortable and warm. Extremely durable (thus far): wear them daily including for trips to the mailbox (½ mile) and spur of the moment jaunts into town. Got another pair in orange because, at 80 y.o., sometimes have trouble finding the black pair early in the morning.
review.name: Highly recommend this slipper...

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Traction Mule V Bootie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Overall wouldn't recommend. The mules are way too tight on top. My feet feel like they are dying a slow death when I try to wear them. They look nice.
review.name: Fit is off

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Traction Mule V Bootie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Amazing shoes! Warm and lightweight. I purchases two pairs.
review.name: Definitely a Must!

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Traction Mule V Bootie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Bought this as a gift - they already own a pair and absolutely love these!
review.name: LOVE them!

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Traction Mule V Bootie - Men's
review.reviewBody: Loved mine so much I bought a pair for my son. Lightweight and outdoor-friendly, and I don't overheat like in fleece slippers. Also a nice secure fit in the heel so they stay snug with plenty of toe room. He loves them as much as I do.
review.name: This is my second pair!

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Traction Mule V Bootie - Men's
review.reviewBody: The perfect winter slipper. Used when skiing , waterproof. But also used casually when running chores. I live in Utah so it's the perfect shoe for the winter.
review.name: High quality slipper

review.itemreviewed: ThermoBall Traction Mule V Bootie - Men's
review.reviewBody: These Mules are incredibly comfortable and fit like a glove. I like how the sole is quite grippy and perfect for indoor/outdoor use.
review.name: Love them!

name: ThermoBall Traction Mule V Bootie - Men's

hasVariant.name: Ultra-Sil 3L/5L/8L Stuff Sack Set
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Ultra-Sil 3L/5L/8L Stuff Sack Set online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got these bags for a winter backcountry trip. They were perfect for stuffing down jackets and other clothing and equipment. They were lightweight, durable and highly recommended.
review.name: Great bags. Lightweight and durable.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are awesome to have around for almost anything. They feel so soft I didn't know if it would soak up water but they have kept everything dry inside of them. I love the three different sizes so you can put almost anything you may need in inside and keep it with you. The smallest one is my favorite.
review.name: Very nice

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received these just before we were to go on a kayaking trip.  These worked great for this trip and the different size options really made it nice. I used one for extra clothes, one for snacks and the other for miscellaneous things.  All three of them stayed dry the entire trip and I even dumped my kayak so everything was floating in the water would for sure recommend these to anyone.
review.name: Great WaterProof Bags

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These bags are very light weight but still sturdy and well made. I like that they are easy to wash in the sink or by hose, clean out and air dry. They held a good amount of weight without tearing. 10/10
review.name: Easy to clean

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love these sea to summit bags. They keep everything dry and contained and I don’t have to worry about it. Great variety of sizes and colors to fit my needs and other people have given me compliments on them.
review.name: Awesome

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely loved these bags for our recent camping trip and hiking adventure. The bags came in a variety of nice, bright red colors, and the material was lightweight so it didn’t add extra weight. I was able to pack all of our clothes and foods in the appropriate sized bags and when the weather hit and it rained, everything stayed dry and fresh! I will totally recommend these for any type of camping or hiking whether it be long-term or just a short day trip.
review.name: Excellent waterproof and light weight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I really liked these multi bags. They came in three different sizes and there easy to use and I use them for almost anything. I like carrying it around and have things in it that I really need and the colors are wonderful and I can find it easier. There great to have around.
review.name: Different sizes

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Stuff sack

Waterproof, weather proof! Great outdoor brand. Material is durable but lightweight. Bags are not near as big as I thought they would be in pictures though. Also no handle. I am disappointed with sizes, but overall quality is good
review.name: Sea to Summit bags

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Absolutely great! My husband and I are so impressed with these bags! They really do keep all the water and dirt out of the bags. They also keep everything dry which is most important when camping/traveling around
review.name: Great!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got picked to do a review on these 3 water proof bags. They all worked great for me. You can just stuff them up and everything doesn't get wet. All my stuff was still dry. I would definitely recommend these bags. I would definitely buy these again.
review.name: Great

name: Ultra-Sil 3L/5L/8L Stuff Sack Set

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut We Care Chalk Bag online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love using bags that tend to be on the larger size. I have oily sweaty skin and go through chalk all the time and this holds a ton without feeling bulky. The bag also having the tube shape is a very no frills design functionally since it’s easy to get in it while climbing so you don’t have to mess around trying to open or close it. My bag came in the blue and grey color way, which is very distinguishable when at bouldering gyms where it might be on the ground surrounded by 20 other chalk bags.
review.name: Great simple chalk bag

review.reviewBody: Love the idea of reducing waste; that's why I got this: just know it may look nothing like the photos! Its right sized and light enough to not be a bother.  I also like the waist cord more than I thought I would (rather then webbing).
review.name: Love It!

review.reviewBody: I have 3 sets. I've been waiting for more colors but the last few years it's been super limited. Awesome pants/jackets. Super fit super comfy super warm. Revitalize these please
review.name: Need more colors again

review.reviewBody: Unzip the pant legs a bit, open the snap and the fly, and put on a cloud of warmth. Snap up the front and feel the gently elasticized waist snug up, with provision to tie it up more securely if need be. Then zip everything up and stuff your hands in your deep front pockets that go under the pants, for a snuggly cozy feeling.
review.name: Warmth and comfortable.

review.reviewBody: I love them perfect to throw over sweats and wear on the porch or for quick outings. I feel warm anytime with these

I tested Ghost Whisperer pants in minus -15 Celsius  and they are a complete failure and will not be going into the mountains with me ever again because the sizing is to small. I am 183 lbs. and wear 32 pants.  I ordered a size large.  The pants fit tight and compress the insulation if you bend your legs at all. Because they are cut so narrow it is not possible to remove the pants without removing your boots. Unfortunately it looks like fashion was a bigger priority than function.
review.name: Ghost Whisperer Pant failure, Do not buy for real use in cold conditions.

review.reviewBody: I’m about a 30 waist and about 32 long. That should mean a small regular. The small is pretty tight, usually stretching the elastic near its limit. The length seems much less than 32. I can’t imagine getting the long 34 inch, but if you are a 32 regular, you may need the medium long.
review.name: Sizes are a bit off.

review.reviewBody: Kept me very warm on the trail and in camp.  Definitely needed in my pack.
review.name: Nice and warm on the trail

review.reviewBody: The MH Ghost Whisperer Pants are some of the Best Down pants I own. They offer great stretch, mobility and are perfect under Soft Shell pants. Very warm and the bottom zip closure even fits over the top of Mountaineering Boots. For reference, I’m about a 37” inch waist and 32” inseam. I went with the Large Regular and the fit is perfect. There’s even some give in the waist to wear heavier tops.
review.name: Great Down Pants

review.reviewBody: I liked it. It was cool. I think camping is fun. Me too.
review.name: Cool thing

name: Ghost Whisperer Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: love this fleece jacket; 6 pockets altogether; wife hates the colors and thinks I'm color blind; oh well...
review.name: love this jacket...

review.reviewBody:
I am 6’3” with +1 arm length. I ordered a medium and am very happy about that.
Reasonable price is due to not over manufacturing this item.
Seamed cuffs, no pocket zippers on the side, make this comfy and well fitted.
I really like the old school feel.
review.name: Very well designed for simplicity

review.reviewBody: Warm cozy fleece, excellent fit, functional double zip breast pockets , nice color. Overall a great garment .
review.name: Excellent hoodie

review.reviewBody: A sturdy and warm fleece jacket.  With proper layering, good for me for temperature upto -10C
review.name: A good fleece hoody

review.reviewBody: It's so warm. I will never use anything  elss but Mountain hardwear
review.name: Its so warm

review.reviewBody: Warm and cozy 😊 I am happy with it I have received a lot of compliments already
review.name: Looks great!

review.reviewBody: This thing’s warm! Cool color way and I love the hoodie. It’s been tested out in the colts 16 degree temps in Vail, CO and it did the trick. Love this fleece. I’m 6’ tall 180 lbs and large fits perfect. I always am a large so this is true to size.
review.name: Very warm and cozy!

review.reviewBody: The pattern and warmth are awesome. Just one feedback in regards to the zipping quality.  The zip is usually stuck at the chest area because of its inside curled sleeve sticking out. Not sure if it’s the quality control or it’s designed to be like that.  Also, the medium size jacket fit is on loose side as I’m 6’0 and weigh 165 lbs.  Not sure if the S would help as it’ll probably make the sleeves shorter.
review.name: Great pattern/warmth; fitting/zipping issues

review.reviewBody: Super Warm and thick. Love the pockets, wish it had a draw string on the bottom, and was 1” longer. I’m 6-1 185 in a size large. It’s boxier then other M-hardware stuff I have.  But on sale it’s a great mid layer. I want the no hood version as well.  Sick winter hoody tho.
review.name: Very warm, well made.

review.reviewBody: I’m 5 ft 8 in and weigh roughly 155 lbs and ordered a small.  It fits great!  Lots of pockets for misc. stuff.  It’s a little puffy in style but not bad all.  So far, it’s been awesome but just need some cooler weather so I can wear it more often.
review.name: Cozy, Warm and Rad!

name: HiCamp Fleece Hoodie - Men's

review.reviewBody:
These lightweight containers are handy around the campsite, RV, or the home and are great for garbage, recycling, or storage. Spring-loaded
and simple to use, just unzip the storage lid and release the tabs and it automatically expands to its full size. When finished using, simply push it
down flat, and secure the nylon tabs on the sides. Fully zippered top to deter pests and keep items in place.
? Made of durable 600D polyester with 2 storage pockets
? 4 interior edge clips secure garbage bags
? 2 longer nylon web handles simplify transporting when full
? Approximate Volume: 29.5 gal. (111 L)
? Dimensions: 19? (48 cm) diameter, 2.5? (6.4 cm) - 24? (61 cm) height
? 2 rugged nylon web handles can be held together in one hand.

review.reviewBody: 10 rating for a narrow foot. I use them for a work shoe, and they breathe super well; so my feet don't get hot in them. Toe box runs a little narrow, if I could exchange for a 1/2 size up ?I would. *However, my Mercury IV Mid GTX Men fit excellent at the same size.
review.name: Comfortable, Durable and easy to put on/take off.

review.reviewBody: I really wish I could have tried this shoe on before buying, I may have liked the next size up. The toe box is a little narrow in the vertical dimension. I am hyper aware when my toes touch the top of the shoe, it feels like they're hitting the front when they're not.  Definitely a better running shoe on the trail than the Hueco Knit. Traction is a little limited over wet rock, these might benefit from a Vibram sole. I love the heel pocket. This is the first shoe in a long time that hasn't given me blisters.
review.name: Nearly perfect for my foot

name: Sertig Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light, compact, quick to inflate, comfortable on the back, but for someone 225 pounds like me, it lacked a little thickness when sleeping on my side. I finally had to opt for something thicker. At 170 cm, the long was perfect for me, the regular would not have done.
review.name: Just a little missed

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: Getting to this mat has been a process for me. After years of sleeping on the ground I finally stepped up to some egg-crate foam. After scolding myself for not having made that move years ago, I stepped up to a "self-inflating" pad that made things even better. However, I would often wake up with pain or stiffness in my hip. I assumed that was just a consequence of an aging body spending the night in a tent. Then I discovered this mat. What a difference! It is lighter than what I had been carrying and far more comfortable. Blowing it up (one of my concerns) is not a problem. Absolutely recommended!
review.name: A Happy Side-Sleeper

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I recently retired my old Therm-a-Rest for this sleeping pad and now I can actually sleep at night! No comparison. It's easy to inflate and I like the mummy shape. I'm exactly 5'6" and the regular works perfectly. This is likely too heavy for PCT through hikers but for my 1-, 2- and 3-night trips, it's perfect.
However, my very favorite Sea to Summit product which was an absolute game-changer for me for backpacking is the Aeros pillow. That has made all the difference between a miserable night and a great one.
review.name: Sleeping SO much better!

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Took this bad boy out on some recent backpacking in the Grand Tetons (Wyoming) and Maroon Bells (Colorado). Major upgrade from my previous MEC pad (that's Canadian REI fyi). Very decent weight given how insanely comfy it is (my bf has the ultralight insulated which is also great, a little lighter). Night temps were around 40 degrees, and I was so toasty (paired with the REI Joule sleeping bag). Super comfy even on uneven surfaces. I sleep on my side/back/front etc. and it was all comfy. So nice to wake up without aches and pains when you are putting your body through grueling hikes!
My only suggestion is to add a feature that would allow two Sea to Summit mats to attach/secure lengthwise to one another (velcro tabs? IDK). Especially if you already got bags that zip together.. So when you are backcountry snuggling you can stay cozy with your boo, or your friend, or whoever is keeping you warm in the mountains.
review.name: Sweet dreamzzz

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: Have used this sleeping mat pretty much every weekend since I have purchased it. I appreciate how lightweight it is and how quick it takes to inflate it. I tend to sleep on my side, and wake up with minimal side/back pain.
review.name: Comfy and Light

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super easy to set up. Haven’t been able to try it outside yet, but when I’ve laid on it on my (clean) kitchen floor, it feels like a dream! Can’t wait to test this on my first trip.
review.name: Easy set up, very comfy!

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: So far I've only spent Memorial Day weekend camping and using this mat (coupled with a Coleman foam mat underneath), both on a plywood bunk in a cabin and on the chilly, Alaska ground. It was AMAZING. I'm 5'1", roughly 112 lbs and curvy, and sleep all over the place (especially in my mummy sleeping bag). I didn't feel ANY pressure on my shoulders or hips whatsoever during both nights. It was easy to unpack and blow up (albeit pretty cumbersome for an asthmatic, but I'll figure out a blow-up method that works better), clean and then roll up to be stored again. It packs pretty small and light, and fits perfectly in my backpack. I highly recommend!
review.name: Absolutely fantastic mat!

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: I purchased this pad in large as I'm a restless side sleeper and I find that there's just not enough wiggle room on regular size pads. If this came in a regular length wide version, I would have purchased that one instead as, at 5'5", I dont need the extra length. This pad performs as it should, with enough lift to keep my hips off the ground and not bottoming out and enough insulation to keep the ground chill a bay. The face material is not clammy and does not produce the noise from movement that some other pads do. If you're looking for an ultralight pad, look elsewhere, but I prefer comfort and this pad has it in aces. Highly recommend!
review.name: Women's comfort light insulated

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: I haven’t slept on it yet... But it’s super light weight and smaller than I expected
review.name: Small and lightweight

review.itemreviewed: Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's
review.reviewBody: I used this mat to sleep outside under the stars and full moon. It was cold (and it wound up raining). However, I was toasty and comfortable!
review.name: Cowboy camping

name: Comfort Light Insulated Sleeping Pad - Women's

hasVariant.name: Sidekick
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Sidekick online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought one for a recent camping trip and it was very useful to store our bulkier items. Putting onto the cars crossbars takes about 5 min, not quite as fast or easy  as the higher end models, but you get what you pay for. Little to no noise on the highway. One down side that should be mentioned is assembly was a pain and requires two people or one person with some patience. All and all it’s a good value. It gets the job done for a decent price with no extra bells or whistles.
review.name: Good Value

review.reviewBody: Expensive crap.   Difficult to put together.  Easily could have come assembled  constantly have problems with one of the locks. I’m afraid of a rock hits it. It will just split wide open.  Not worth the money. I should’ve bought a budget brand same thing for less money.  Thule It’s not the quality product they used to be.
review.name: Cheaply made crap

review.reviewBody: Impressive product, realizing how much engineering it took to make this product fit a curved vehicle roofline and also how everything in my car fit inside made me supremely grateful. Thank you Thule team!
review.name: Exceptional product

review.reviewBody:
I’ve used the sidekick for one weekend trip and it was great! The widest point is not the bottom so I was not able to store my hard gear in it, but was able to rearrange my gear and put all my soft sided gear in it. 

Assembly takes 2 people so be prepared. Installation is a piece of cake. 

It rained the whole way up on my first tip and all my gear was dry and clean upon arrival. 

The sides are flexible so be carful when you lock the case as the locking mechanism can turn but not catch.
review.name: Great for Weekend trips

review.reviewBody: The overall products are always amazing. The issue we had was that the packaging came and looked like it had been beat up to hell and back. Luckily the item wasn’t damaged the other issue is you need to work on your email system? It tells you that below is the tracking information but there is no below and no tracking information. This is the third product that I’ve ordered in the past month and they all have done the same thing I would really like to know where my item is you shouldn’t have one of your team email themselves and they can see that it doesn’t work work
review.name: Product amazing. Packaging not so good. And

review.reviewBody: Perfect size for the top of my pickup truck. Easy to install. Holds a lot more than you think.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: This thing went threw my garage and got severed in two pieces just needed a little love and the locks replaced and it is mint.
review.name: durable

review.reviewBody: This is no better quality than any generic roof top box. You are definitely paying for the name. The connections to the rack are little more than bolts. the locks are cheap and the mechanism to prop up the top, always seems like it is on the verge of breaking...
review.name: Not worth the money

review.reviewBody: I bought this a month ago to put on a Jeep JL.  This unit compared to other Thules I have owned is made from cheap materials, catches too much wind on the highway and is a pain to put on and take off.  Don't buy this box you'll end up returning it.
review.name: Cheap materials, cumbersome to attach.

name: Sidekick
