review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] very cushioned and sturdy, seem very durable and i am excited to wear them more. Cute color too, tan and white make a cute design that will match anything!
review.name: Cute everyday shoes!

review.reviewBody:
it's good and comfortable. easy to put in and walk, but not a good choice if you need to stand for long time. I feel a bit heel sore(or pain?) on my left foot while standing for a little longer. Not sure if it's just me or not.
these shoes doesn't have arch support. you must change the insole if you need special foot care like me (I have bunion and high arch. )
there is no enough space inside to put a thicker insole if you have bunion and thick sole of feet, but wide and soft enough to fit a bunion foot.
Otherwise, it's a good and pretty shoes.
review.name: good to walk, but not really for standing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The look nice and certainly are good for the streets of nyc. They haven’t gotten visibly dirty at all. The size runs large and gives blisters on the back of the foot because of that, so that’s the reason I took away stars. They are cushy though.
review.name: Cushy, runs large

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fit and arch support; light weight yet sturdy
review.name: Great fit and arch support;

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The women’s KS86 Sneaker is really comfortable. The size fits my foot. It’s really good for walking and running. Very sturdy shoes. I love wearing these shoes for my walks.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody:
I wonder if I can wear them with a cocktail dress?!! I have a very difficult foot to fit - no arch, broad toe box. So I need arch support and width but not extra length. This sneaker takes care of my foot shape, is light weight to wear around the house and on errands and cleans up after a kitchen spill.
Thank you, a gazillion times.
review.name: Like walking on air - don't want to take them off

review.reviewBody: Some shoes you have to break in, not the case with this one. I put them on, and they were instantly comfortable. They are stylish and I like the knobby soles - as I live in a wintry area. Nice roomy toe box & even an extra pair of laces. Can't go wrong!
review.name: Great Fit

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes. They are so comfortable and I can walk all day in them.
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: I have a hard time finding shoes that have enough room in the toe box without being too big at the heel. Keen original fit boots and shoes work great for my feet and I have never had a break in period. They are always comfortable from the first wear with good support and stability. This shoe works well for me walking on gravel trails, pavement, and at the gym.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, I had to return these. I mostly wear foot shaped shoes but decided on purchasing these based on countless other reviews which claimed these were wide and some even saying they had to return the shoes because they were too wide. I do own a Keen hiking boot that I can wiggle my toes in. I was hoping this would be the case but the KS86 were way too tight in the toe box. Very disappointed that I couldn't keep them because they are so pretty.
review.name: Super cute but narrow toe box

name: KS86 Shoe - Women's

They have useful features with the extra zippered pocket and smooth rear pocket closures from Velcro (no buttons to catch on things). The copper color is particularly nice for me.

hasVariant.name: Aeros Pillow Ultralight Traveller
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Aeros Pillow Ultralight Traveller online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super convenient. Small and compact, adjustable firmness, easy to blow up. Great purchase!
review.name: Worth it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I adore this travel pillow so much that I ordered a second. It's the lightest and super comfy. Get one (or two) you won't be disappointed!
review.name: Great pillows

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The perfect travel pillow. The weight, packable size and flexible inflation make it a no-brainer
review.name: The perfect travel pillow. The

review.reviewBody: This might just be the perfect travel pillow. It packs up SO SMALL, it is much more girthy than my usual compact pillow, the large opening for inflate/deflate is fantastic, and the neck snap is a game-changer. I even like the teal color. However, the pillow has not lasted very long. It has gone on less than 10 trips and now won't hold air. :( I am always careful not to overinflate it to accommodate for changes in cabin pressure and you'd think for the cost of it, it would last longer.
review.name: LOVE this pillow, but it didn't last long

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Easy to inflate and deflate fit comfortable around neck.
review.name: Easy to inflate and deflate

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Taken on a few long haul plane and bus rides and is a major upgrade to my old bulky foam one. Super light and compact but supportive once inflated. If you are lucky enough to get a row to yourself can also work on its side as a horizontal pillow.
review.name: Great Travel companion

review.reviewBody: Great solution to those bulky neck pillows. Comfortable and so compact when stowed
review.name: Great solution to those bulky

review.reviewBody: As much as I like S2S, this pillow is a big disappointment. Pretty much unusable, it’s so small and narrow around the back of my neck, it provides no support when I rest my head back. The material is nice, and it seems well-made, but was a waste of money for me since it doesn’t fit.
review.name: Way too small in the back of neck

review.reviewBody: I purchased this for my flight to the UK that was abruptly ended ten days before takeoff due to Covid! I was so excited for this new travel companion but our time together would have to wait. Fast forward to end of August...road trip to hike and camp in ID and MT! On the 12 day journey this neck support was amazing in the passenger seat when I needed to fall into the land of Zzz’s. Purchase with confidence!
review.name: Neck Support At It’s Finest!

review.reviewBody: I've been looking for pillow that is full size when I am in transit but doesn't take any space in my bag in between. This one also weights nothing. 20D fabric seems to be light and strong enough. Seatosummit valve is pretty cool, easy to inflate, easy to adjust and easy to deflate... what else do you need? It's on expensive end but you will be happy having it on 9 hours flight. Cool colours available :D
review.name: Full size, packs small, weight nothing

name: Aeros Pillow Ultralight Traveller
Aeros Pillow Ultralight Traveller

The Enduras were baggy in the knees, and I liked the Specialized Pad better. I have 5 pairs of Endura Bibs and the older ones lost density in the chamois. The new FS260's are doing well. Anything with the 600 or 700 series pad is good.

review.reviewBody: I’m a trad climber that always seems to pack heavy. These poles have changed my approach time and difficulty by a lot. I love them. They pack up nicely and height adjustable.
review.name: Approach game changer

review.reviewBody: Love these poles. Previously had the Alpine Carbon Cork. These feel very light but solid. Easily collapsable and has the best hand grips out there. The cork is so much better that the foam on some of there other models. I also like how the M/L grip is a bit larger which feels good in the hand. Ive heard some reviews that the locking pin sometimes collapses under pressure but mine have been fine. Skip the higher priced carbon flzs and get these! Also the color on the website looks more orangy/red but they are a true red in reality.
review.name: Favorites!

review.reviewBody:
These hiking poles have exceeded my expectations. 
The lightweight design reduces fatigue on long hikes. 
I find the grip comfortable and secure, even on steep terrain. 
The poles also have a sleek and modern appearance. 
I highly recommend them to any avid hiker.
review.name: Great hiking poles

review.reviewBody: Perfect size for international travel. Lightweight, sturdy, and with adjustable length can share one with a taller friend in need.
review.name: 10/10 Would Recommend to a Friend

review.reviewBody: Cork grips kept my hands dry, free from blistering. Lower grips great on up hill climbs. Poles break down into small form factor for easy stowing when not needed. Well constructed, great value!
review.name: Hiking the Great Smokey Mountains

review.reviewBody: I bought these to fold up and fit into the exterior pack sleeves for alpine ridge ascents and these poles are just what I was looking for. Lighter and quieter when planted than my old poles, the main benefit is they fold up very compact and can be put away so as not to be a snag hazard when scrambling on class 3-4 rock ascents where both hands are needed. Far superior to poles that just telescope down and are mounted onto the exterior of the pack, which can be a serious snag hazard, especially when down climbing.
review.name: Compact, light, and strong

review.reviewBody: The locking mechanism decided to stop popping up one day, only after a few uses. Have tried to fix but it seems that something has really gone wrong. Saw another of the same poles at the used REI shop with the same issue. I have submitted for return at this point. Consider another pole if you don't want to be caught out like me with a heavy pack to haul.
review.name: 2nd Broken set I've seen

review.reviewBody:
These poles are absolutely great, until they break... As a couple of other reviewers already have noted, the little button that locks the pole in its extended position clearly has a weak spot in its construction. It can break, and that will render the pole useless. It has now happened to me twice. First time during a hike in the Scandinavian mountains, after only a couple of days' use. Not good. I managed to fix it with a piece of steel wire so I could continue. I got a new pair through the dealer, but now it has happened again. This time on a shorter hike, where I needed them to pitch my tent. The button broke on one pole, and on the other one it got jammed inside the pole. Both poles broken, flabbiest tent pitch ever.

Black Diamond, this really needs to be fixed!
review.name: A word of warning! Button can break!

review.reviewBody: Brought these for their first voyage in the Sierras of CA for a 8-mile hike. Overall, very comfortable, lightweight and felt strong. I like that they can be very compact at times. Plan to use them for recreation as well as Search and Rescue.
review.name: Great Compact Trekking Poles

review.reviewBody: Solid, sturdy, comfortable, stylish trekking poles. There isn’t much more to say as it lives up to its description. Always happy to recommend.
review.name: Solid

name: Pursuit FLZ Trekking Poles

review.reviewBody: Did not really care for this jacket. Expected amazing things from HH and was interested in the Recco reflector, but ultimately the quality was just not there. Sizing feels a bit snug, definitely a slim fit, but the main issue is it’s too short for the size. Outer layer feels cheap and like it would rip in an instant if I brushed up against a tree. I returned it. I wound up searching harder and then tried the North Face Thermoball 3 in 1, which I also returned because of a cheap feel and poorly fit wrist cuffs. Wound up settling for a 686 Smarty 3 in 1, and am shocked by how much better the quality was than these other two (while also being available for a better deal!). The 686 has a nice thick, heavy duty outer shell which feels way more waterproof, better wrist cuffs, way slicker and more stylish inner layer, and just overall feels way more serious for real snowboarding and skiing. Save your time on this search for an 3 in 1 and go for the 686!
review.name: Not as great as I expected from HH

name: Swift 3-in-1 Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Platypus GravityWorks Carbon Element online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: GravityWorks Carbon Element
hasVariant.description: Buy the Platypus GravityWorks Carbon Element online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love my gravity system, and this makes the water taste great.
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: We live and work with indigenous people in the headwaters of the Amazon basin. We use our GravityWorks filter all the time in the village. The added carbon filter helps improve flavor on some of the less-desirable water sources. Have never had a problem with the filter system. As long as a curious rat doesn't chew thru the hoses.
review.name: Improves flavor

review.reviewBody: Good product and works as advertised. Makes the water taste better and doesn't slow the flow too much. At the reasonable price, small size, and low weight, I'll keep buying these.
review.name: Works as advertised, will buy again

review.reviewBody: This carbon filter works great but I use it sparingly, and only when the water truly tastes bad, for two reasons. First, it significantly slows down the filtering speed. Second, it inhibits back-flushing and makes it very difficult to purge the hose of air bubbles.
review.name: Works great when needed.

review.reviewBody: I'm a backpacker, I use this with the Gravity Works filter - does a great job removing unwanted flavors from most water sources. Makes the system a little bit bulkier, but IMHO it is worth the extra bulk and minimal weight increase.
review.name: A plus for the Gravity Works system...

review.reviewBody: Recent 6 day / night camping into the Boundry Waters - first time for me - my camp mates could not believe how well the system worked and , with the filters, how good the water tasted - they all commented they would be buying the complete system once back home.
review.name: Filters worked great - water tasted awesome

review.reviewBody: Website lacks the information. I'm assuming I can run the chlorinated water through it just as with the GravityWorks normal filter, but then again doesn't this thing remove things like chlorine? Won't that just exhaust its lifespan?
review.name: Seems good but not sure how to clean

review.reviewBody: Colorado river water still didn't taste great, but hate to think what it would have been w/o the carbon element. It is small and light.
review.name: good addition to basic system

review.reviewBody: But it's hard to fit into the storage bag with the original filter set, which has very limited room for an additional in-line filter.
review.name: It's a good product

review.reviewBody: Purchased 3 months and have taken on two backpacks. Second one was into a remote area of Florida with no moving water, only swamp ponds with a lot of algae, scum and guppies, etc. The system with the carbon produced almost perfect drinkable water. The only concern was a light brown still in the very brown tea-like pond water. It has been 3 weeks since that adventure and neither of us were sick or any problems. Gotta love the platypus filtration system as it has performed flawlessly.
review.name: Excellent results

name: GravityWorks Carbon Element

review.reviewBody: Glad to replace my old #4 with this cam that seems about half the weight. I've been slowly replacing my old camalots with the ultralight version. Sure do wish the 3-1/2 would be released as ultralight. . .
review.name: Love my new Ultralight #4 Camalot

review.reviewBody: Upgrading to ultralight cams from my previous 2015 C4 cams is huge difference in weight. Looking forward to feeling lighter for some big alpine days.
review.name: A Weight difference you can feel

review.reviewBody: Gradually replacing rack of C4s with the ultralights. No complaints.
review.name: Light and Lindy.

review.reviewBody: Super smooth action and uncannily light, can't wait to test in the field
review.name: Smooth Action

review.reviewBody: Great cams that live up to the name. I get that the expiration date could scare people but if you use them lots it’s well worth the upgrade from the normal ones.
review.name: Noticeably lighter

review.reviewBody: Just got back from an alpine trip in Switzerland. The ultralights size 2 and 3 came on every route and excelled. #4 on selected routes. Barely noticeable in the pack on the approach, or on the harness. Seems like they have not caught on so much in Europe - my Swiss guide partner was wowed. We had to leave 2 behind on a rappel misadventure. Came home and immediately replaced! Durability seems acceptable despite the lighter construction
review.name: So great for alpine, or anything steep

review.reviewBody: Worth the extra dough if you need the weight savings.
review.name: Light

review.reviewBody: Significantly lighter than the Camalot 4. No complaints.
review.name: Go figure, ultralight is.. lighter!

review.reviewBody: So I just completed my 180th ascent of El Capitan a week ago. for my 60 th birthday I treated my self to a selection of ultra-light cams, BD colored carbiners, and some other BD cams. LOVE EM! I have been climbing for 40+ years and I placed my first camming device 39 years ago! (Yeah, it wasn't a BD) I have tried a variety of other cams, some have their advantages, alas, I NEVER go up El Capitan without BD cams since they first were on my rack some 35+ years ago. You just can't beat their reliability.
review.name: beautiful rugged.

review.reviewBody: Just bought a rack of ultralights. Great rack, barely feel it’s there!
review.name: Light trad gear

name: Camalot Ultralight

review.reviewBody: Big fan of the boa on these shoes, just so much nicer then dealing with laces. Also very comfortable and a great shoe for mountain biking. I like the  grey color as well, as it doesn't make me feel like a mega dork in black clip in shoes. The velcro strap hasn't really come into play yet, but I guess its there if I need it. My feet stay comfortable the entire ride, I'd definitely buy another pair.
review.name: comfy shoes

review.reviewBody: I’ve used them on a few rides already and they are very comfortable. They are stiff enough to sufficiently transfer power onto the pedals but flexible enough to hike short distances when needed. The material seems to be of good quality so I would expect them to last a long time.
review.name: Comfortable, sturdy, stable for walking

review.reviewBody:
I have been really happy with these.  Over rides the closure does loosen slightly and after ~2200 ridden miles on these the rocky terrain where I often ride has taken a toll on the tread of these shoes.  

I appreciate that these have held up to some pretty legit abuse and that they are comfortable to walk around in.
review.name: Almost great....., but...?

review.reviewBody:
I had an older model of the X-ALP Summit shoes which I liked quite a bit.  Unfortunately I damaged the ratchet closing system in a fall and decided it was time to try out some Lake brand shoes my bike shop kept telling me about.  While I did like the Lake's- they were comfortable and breathed well- they started producing a squeaking noise that I wasn't ever able to get rid of, not even after changing pedals nor cleats.  That noise followed me between bikes, so I know it was the shoes themselves.  Lake ended up ghosting me when trying to deal with them for a warranty issue, so I decided they could bugger off and ended up purchasing these updated version of the X-ALP Summit shoes.

These new shoes with the BOA closure system fixed my only complaint about the old Summit's.  The ratchet closing system was ok, but this BOA is just that much better.  I really love the Smoke Grey color, something different than the usual black or white shoes- but still neutral enough to go with everything.  I sized up one size from my previous Summit's because after having ridden the Lake's a while, I realized my old ones were a little snug in the toe box.  Sizing up fixed that, while still being a comfortable length without being too long.  These are now just as comfortable as the 2x pricier Lake's... without the squeak :). Also the Lake's were quite a bit stiffer-- and I know some people like that, but I never did get used to it.  Walking off the bike is so much more comfortable with these.

Sorry I ever doubted you, X-ALP Summit Shoes!
review.name: Great shoes!

name: X-ALP Summit Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Good snow pants
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody: These pants seem to be made pretty well with some good pocket features, but I don't know how you can sell pants that are 32-34 waist (Medium) without an elastic waist. The inside of the waist has velcro to make them tighter, but if you are a 33 or 34, you won't get the waist snapped lol. Same with the large...fits the low end of the waist measurements for a LG.  Pants are too baggy for me.
review.name: WAIST RUNS SMALL, LEGS ARE BAGGY

review.reviewBody:
I bought them for a snowboarding trip, only wore them 3 times before I noticed the stitching at the crotch had failed and started pulling apart.
The pants are the correct size and not to tight anywhere, just poorly made.

Save your money and find a different pair of pants that will last more than a single use!
review.name: Poor Quality

review.reviewBody: These ski pants are nice and check all the boxes for warmth, water resistance, fit, etc. I received them and was excited until I noticed that they offer no protection for errant ski edges that will definitely cut the inner lower leg of the ski pants. I have not seen a pair of ski pants in recent years that don’t offer a protective cover to avoid cutting the ski pants lower legs. Unfortunately, I’ll be returning them even though they match my needs to a tee otherwise. Probable good for snowboarding and other winter sports, just not skiing.
review.name: Not good for skiing

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. I get extra 25% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody: I’ve had a number of other snowboarding pants sized at m 32-34in which have fit fine go even a bit loose in the past. These are not properly sized and clearly other reviews have shown the same. Goodluck if you size up.
review.name: “Misrepresented” sizing

review.reviewBody: Bought these for snowshoeing & they are exactly what I was looking for. The built in interior belt made keeping them up easy. I like the integrated gators too. Lots of pockets help me keep all my stuff in easy reach.
review.name: Great price, great warm pants.

review.reviewBody:
6'0, 205lbs, 33in inseam.

As others have said, the fit is off to a frustrating level. Length is good, loose fit is perfect, BUT the waist! You made the waist too small. And since every other part of the fit is good, going up a size would make the pants too long and too baggy. Granted, I can wear them, but it takes more effort than it should to cinch them up, and a few extra happy hours and they truly won't fit. For the price they are a really good (not great) pant. But a lot of people who default to a Large will be frustrated. Please correct for next year; belts are cheap.
review.name: Waist if off

review.reviewBody: Order a medium and the sizing is definitely incorrect on these.  Had to return
review.name: Sizing is wrong

review.reviewBody: Took these out on the slopes of Park City. I am an Amateur snow boarder/ outdoor enthusiast and these were perfect. Kept me insulated and kept me dry after many many spills down the mountain. No rips and no tears after hours of abuse. I also like the many zippered pockets to secure your items.  Great snow pants!
review.name: Excellent for Snowboarding

review.itemreviewed: Rooted In Nature Ferns Crew Sweatshirt
review.reviewBody:
Parks Project: 
Sweater is so cute and comfy, very high quality! Parks Project is a great brand! 

Backcountry: 
My experience with Backcountry was one of the worst I’ve had with an online retailer. Their handling of my order was shockingly unprofessional. I ordered a women’s Parks Project sweatshirt on 11/24, but instead received the wrong item (a men’s Patagonia vest) on 11/29 . Customer service initially apologized and said I could keep the vest free of charge as a courtesy for their mistake, and that my replacement would ship out immediately. But when I followed up on 12/10 after hearing nothing back, they backtracked on their promise. 

They told me I now had to either return the vest or pay full price ($120) for it in order to get the item I originally purchased ($60). This was infuriating since they had already admitted fault and told me the vest was mine to keep as an apology so I had already gifted it to my fiancé to wear. Instead of taking accountability, they tried to make their mistake my responsibility. 

Mistakes happen, but the way this company handled theirs—by backtracking on promises and creating extra hassle for the customer—is unacceptable. Backcountry needs to take accountability for their mistakes and honor the commitments they make to customers. This kind of behavior is unacceptable and has completely undermined my trust in them. I won’t be ordering from them again.
review.name: Mainly rating backcountry experience

name: Rooted In Nature Ferns Crew Sweatshirt

review.reviewBody: Had my eyes on these for some time and glad I finally decided to get them. Only worn a couple times but comfortable out of the box. Well designed. Great looking shoe.
review.name: Just right

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this shoe for a trip my wife and I recently took to hike the Jungfrau region of the Swiss Alps. It was amazingly comfortable straight out of the box, with no break in needed. We did a number of  hikes with more than  2,700 vertical ft of climbing with no foot fatigue or hot spots. These truly are all day shoes!
Side note, I accidentally bought two pairs when I ordered and was going to return the extra pair, but have decided to keep them for when the first pair eventually wears out. I always loved my various La Sportiva climbing shoes and these hiking shoes carry on that excellence. They do however run slightly small so I sized up a half size as others have suggested.
review.name: Comfortable and great performing

review.reviewBody: This is my second of third pair.  This is my warm weather everyday shoe.  My everyday winter show is the Scarpa Zen Pro.
review.name: Great all round shoe

review.reviewBody: So you know I like them. Fit like a glove. My everyday in the office and hiking show all in one.
review.name: Just bought my 5th and 6th pairs

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes to replace my Trail Ridge Low 10.5.  I love the narrow width of La Sportiva Shoes, and was looking forward to this pair.  I ordered the same size as my TL-Low (10.5) and these Spire GTX were WAY to big.  I returned them for a 10.0, which were the right length, but the width is very wide for my feet.  I've hiked in them for 2 days and they are very uncomfortable with a lot of heal slip.  I also have to cinch them all the way such that my feet hurt in order to have a decent fit.   I think they would be fine for the right foot, but I'm disappointed that La Sportiva has such variability in their sizing.  And unfortunately they no longer make the Trail Ridge Low.
review.name: Too wide

review.reviewBody: Just bought another pair. Been crushing it in the shoes since last September. Work as a pro ski patroller and Bicycle mechanic. I have put the shoes to the test in various New England conditions. The vibram sole and gortex outer Really makes the difference for me and what I need in a shoe everyday.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody: I recently bought these as a lighter shoe to accompany the Mid GTX I bought last year. This shoe is fantastic and checks off many boxes for me. I appreciate how light they are, the sturdiness is very noticeable, and the traction is fantastic. The heel construction allows for a very easy & natural gait, which I appreciate. Great shoe and recommended!
review.name: Fantastic!

review.reviewBody: I bought my pair on a trip to Iceland recently in the only clothing store I could find open on a Sunday in Reykjavik, and they saved my feet for sure. The next day I climbed a steep, rocky path to visit an extinct volcano, the day after that hiked up a glacier to drink direct from the source, and over the next several days climbed up and down many hills to visit waterfalls. I was expecting blisters; I had none. I knew nothing about this brand prior to buying these boots (I don’t do much hiking and don’t know much at all about hiking boots), and my choices frankly were limited to what brands this small store carried and what sizes were available. I can’t believe my luck finding something that fit so well, required zero break in, and was comfortable from the moment I put them on. They are lightweight, kept my busy feet from drowning in sweat and, as they’re a low-slung model, avoided any ankle-bone chafing that has irritated me in the past with brief encounters with standard hiking boots. I admit that I went to Iceland unprepared for just how rigorous it would be (Hoka sneakers are fine for all the walking I do in the hospital, but Iceland demands proper boots). These boots saved me for sure. I hate to think of how my much-anticipated trip would have turned out without them, and I know what’ll go in my bag first for my next adventure.
review.name: Saved my trip!

review.reviewBody: women’s Spire GTX Is the best shoe I have ever put on my feet! They saved me in Switzerland and Italy! They were amazing on the mountains and on the cobblestones. I never want to take them off!
review.name: These shoes saved my feet!

review.reviewBody: Just bought my third pair. My everyday shoes for work and trail. Fit like a glove and offer great support/stiffness. Last me about a year. This third pair is running a bit smaller than the first two.
review.name: Most comfortable and supportive

name: Spire GTX Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is second light - first was stolen - and love it. Works great, easy to charge and last all week - avg 80 miles commuting.
review.name: Great light and lasts long

review.reviewBody: Easy to take off the bike and charge. Light is nice and bright.
review.name: Works well for me

review.reviewBody: The light is bright, with multiple settings.  The issue is the rubber strap for the base, which is integrated and cannot be replaced separately.  Mine is now torn after less than a half a year of use.  Don't buy this light set until this issue is resolved.  You can buy cheap lights on Amazon that have replaceable straps.
review.name: Bright but poor design.

review.reviewBody: Nice light.  Here is the problem.  To recharge you need to remove the base from the light.  It is impossible to do this while the light is on your seatpost.  So the only real option is to remove the light and then work to open up the flap to the USB port.  This is difficult even off the bike.  But if you work it, it will release to allow to recharge.  After a couple months, the rubber strap which holds the light to your seatpost, broke. Now it seems the light is no longer usable.  I to not think the base is replaceable.  I intend to return to Backcountry for return.
review.name: Nice light design needs some improvement

review.reviewBody:
I've been meaning to buy a light for my bike for quite a while but all the lights I'd come across looked bulky and stuck out like an eye sore on my dark grey on black bike. This light is so low-profile and the right colors that it nearly disappears on my bike. That is until you turn it on. Holy smokes this thing is bright! 

There are several different settings so when I get bored with one I can swap to a different one. I haven't had to charge it yet but I like that it comes off the mounting strap instead of having to pull everything off the bike.
review.name: Sleek & Bright

review.reviewBody: I had been riding in an ancient pair of Sidis which were great, but had seen better days.  I decided to go with these lace ups after hearing good things about them and I'm happy that I did!  They are light, nice looking, comfortable, and have a stiff carbon sole that seems very efficient. review.reviewBody: I just barely got to use my bag on this last trip. I needed something large that could be fine outdoors for a while.
review.name: Biggest bag i own

review.reviewBody: We bought this for my teenage son’s adventure trip to South Dakota. He reported it was a great purchase - it’s really big and carried a lot of stuff, which he needed for this trip, and it was very durable.
review.name: Great bag, great value

review.reviewBody: I took the bag out on a 2 week trip and it has already blown out a zipper and ripped at the stitching. Hopefully I can get it replaced because I like the company they usually make good products.
review.name: Not what I was expecting

review.reviewBody: The 105l pack is great for traveling because it holds a lot of stuff. I used it for one trip and didn’t have to stress about closing the zip when it was full. The downside is that it is not very durable and there are a few rub holes in the side of mine.
review.name: Holds lots of things

review.reviewBody: I purchased for a trip, knowing I was gonna be on a baas boat.  Didn't capsize, but clothes and other contents were wet inside...just from wake splash. Defeated the entire reason I bought it
review.name: Defeated the point of buying

review.reviewBody:
The 105L bag is definitely durable. The large side pocket for shoes or dirty clothes is really handy. But this bag is so uncomfortable to carry, the metal connectors would come undone if I had to shift or adjust the bag and the whole bag would fall to the ground. I had to drag this bag across multiple airports because of this. Hence the durability comment, the bag has been dragged around a ton and still has no holes. 

I think it's probably only useful for big light items like winter gear. 

Do not buy this bag if you intend to use the straps because they will not stay connected!
review.name: Staps are terrible

review.reviewBody:
100L had 2 gallon sized side pockets, and a large main center pocket. There’s also a mesh pocket and little detail pockets as well.

Carrying types: Sling, Backpack Straps, carrying handles

Packing: Will fill to full capacity, and has cinch straps
review.name: As Described and Durable

review.reviewBody: I use these all the time - from packing to multi-week long expeditions in the winter time, packing for flights, and packing to hit the road and having gear organized and protected in these durable bags. Ive got a couple of the 40L ones and about 6 of the 105L ones I use for winter expeditions.
review.name: Best duffles out there

review.reviewBody: Love this bag for roadtrips!! Its got plenty of space, durable straps for tossing it around while camping, and I loveee the color. Currently I have two of these and already thinking about snagging another. Highly recommend!
review.name: Perfect Roadtrip Bag

review.reviewBody:
Great bag, really like the material.

I don't like the metal buckle connectors. Every time I went to throw it on my shoulders I was constantly worried that the 2 metal pieces were sitting correctly. Never had a problem with the plastic buckle snap side.

It is a bit big to carry on the shoulders. I took it to Europe and def wished I had wheels.

Given the strap issues and the carrying capacity on the shoulders, this has switched to a car camping bag and the straps have stayed off. It is great for clothing/bedding storage.

Would love to see a wheeled option :)
review.name: Great bag, dislike straps

review.reviewBody:
I originally purchased this helmet in the orange storm and returned it to swap out for the primer grey.  A couple of quick nitpicks aesthetic things I noticed that have no bearing on performance, but that I wish I'd known before ordering.  On the Orange Storm helmet the one I received did not have the orange stitching on the earflaps like in the photo (it was grey). The grey trim around the bottom back of the helmet and around the vents has a bit of a subtle green tint to it (thought it was a true grey).  And the foam that you can see through the vents has bright/royal blue flecks in it.  The same blue flecks are in the black interior foam showing through the vents on my primer grey Pret Fury X helmet as well.  Not a big deal but I didn't expect any color in that foam. Again, no bearing on performance but things I wish I knew beforehand and would have saved me the return time and cost.

Fit-wise, I do really like the fit. I currently have a Smith Maze MIPS and a Giro Ledge helmet both in Large and this Pret I picked up is a Large as well.  When I first put it on it felt a little big, but the dial on the back took only a slight turn of a few clicks and it snugged up to a nice custom feeling fit. So it seems to be in line with sizing on those other brands from what I can tell.  

I really like the fidlock buckle.  That is a plus I didn't know I needed but it's cool.  I've tried it on with a few different goggles (Oakley, Spy and Wildhorn) and all seem to fit well with the brim, closing the gap.  

The bungee style goggle strap in the back has worked well so far, but I'm curious to see how it holds up over time since it's like a small bungee cord.  The good thing is that I seem to have seen that this can be purchased as a replacement part if I'm not mistaken.  So there ever is an issue it should be replaceable. The vents are nice on this one and I really like the adjustability.  Never had that on any other helmets and it seems easy enough to work the switch.  

Style-wise, I do like this helmet.  It has a great look and seems to be constructed well.  I like that the liner covers the entire interior of the helmet.  My Smith Maze is a MIPS helmet, and has thinner strips of padding on applied to the plastic MIPS liner that's mostly exposed.

Overall this helmet seems just a bit more premium and well made with more thought to detail than the other helmets I've had.  I'm definitely a fan and hope to be sticking with Pret next time I need a fresh helmet.
review.name: Great helmet

review.reviewBody: Great helmet. It has a lightweight, high quality feel. The contour of the front of the helmet fit my glade goggles perfectly without any air gaps. So far it seems like a perfect new addition to the locker.
review.name: Comfortable, lightweight, high quality

review.reviewBody: Gotten a couple days in with this helmet and couldn't be happier. I have a wider head and this fits perfectly.
review.name: Lightweight. Well made. Comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Pret helmets fit so well, I can shake my head without the chin strap fixed and it stays on!
A perfect combo of lightweight protection.
review.name: I love my Pret Fury X helmet

review.reviewBody: All the features, all the specs, super chill look...round fit.  It's possible I have a large, oddly shaped noggin.  This helmet seems to be a slightly round contour fit vs a traditional oval fit.  I imagine it would have bothered me as the day got long.  Other than that, I love the wool liner.  Vents were easy to open/close as needed.  Adjusting the helmet fit was super easy.  It just didn't fit my head.
review.name: Wanted to love it

review.reviewBody: The durable outer shell and impact-absorbing inner lining provide excellent protection on the slopes. I get extra 15% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

name: Fury X Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: I LOVE these boots! they are perfect and super fitting for most outfits. BUT breaking in these boots are so hard! DO NOT wear these all day immediately after buying, also they might seem to small at first but they stretch to your foot! do not size up because these are tight!
review.name: Perfect boot for any outfit
comment: Hello! Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear the footwear has lived up to your expectations. And we are sorry to hear of the rough break-in period! We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: These are literally the best boots I’ve ever purchased. I have super sensitive, flat feet where sneakers are uncomfortable. I can confidently say that I wear these babies all day and walk miles in them. They are super high quality. I love how you can tell they were hand made with love.
review.name: Can’t live without
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: These are very high quality boots that run true to size. That said know the actual width of your foot before trying to cram a D into a B and then writing a nasty review because it doesn’t fit! This isn’t Cinderella, you can just buy the right sized boot!
review.name: High quality and true to size
comment: Thanks for this great review! We are excited to serve you again!
It's great to hear the Clara is working well for you!

review.reviewBody: These boots are so very pretty, but I couldn't even wear them to break them in they were so stiff. Love the look, but can't wear them. Have to sell them.
review.name: Couldn't even wear them - way too stiff!

review.reviewBody: Love them but there's no way these are a medium width. I am relaibly an 8.5 B across many many boot brands. I fit into an 8.5 on these length wise but wayyyy too narrow. I tried for a 9 and my pinkie toe is still squished, a 9.5 will be too long and look like a clown shoe. So disappointed! However I will buy a pair as soon as they make a wider shoe.
review.name: TOO NARROW
comment: Thank you for your review. We will pass your suggestions along to the proper channels. I'm sorry we don't have anything that works currently. We hope to serve you again in the future!

review.reviewBody: I went into a store to get sized for these because I really wanted them but they weren’t available locally.  I was sized for 7.  I have since bought 7.5 and 8 and returned both.  At this point I am too stubborn to quit and have ordered 8.5 and 9.  They are lovely in person and they will be amazing once I can get my feet in a pair!  You may especially need a larger size if you have high arches.
review.name: Size up!
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you. Thank you for providing this sizing advice. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: These boots are perfect for any outfit. You can dress them up or down. I just got them today and was wearing them in, and after many hours in these heeled boots, my feet are not killing me. Amazing. I wear a 10 in the iron ranger but the 9 1/2 of these fits best. My heel was super loose in the 10. I have wide feet and super high arches and am so happy to find boots that are comfortable.
review.name: Stunning Boots for Every Outfit
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody: I usually wear a size 8 so that is what I bought. I should have gotten a 1/2 size larger. They are beautiful and really well made but I have never worn them since they are too small.
review.name: Beautiful boots but run small

review.reviewBody: I got my Claras about 3 years ago. Though they didn't see much wear during COVID I wore them a ton the first year and they have held up great. The laces they come with are terrible, but that's a minor problem to fix. I wear them for hours and hours at a time including while traveling and walking a lot. They look great with many kinds of outfits.
review.name: A long-term staple purchase
comment: Thank you for your review! We are glad to hear that your boots are working well for you, minus the lacing. We hope to continue to serve you in the future!

review.reviewBody:
I’ve had these boots in black for six months now, and they’re the first heeled boot I can wear for a full 8 hours of teaching. They were a nightmare to break in, but after several weeks of wearing them for an hour or two at a time they’re my most comfortable shoes. 

I just picked up a pair of Harriets so that I can rotate and let these dry out with boot trees. I can tell those will be just as comfortable, but the Clara’s are already my go-to shoe in the mornings! 

I love them so much I also picked up a pair of silversmiths. I can tell I won’t need shoes again for years.
review.name: Finally a wearable heeled boot
comment: Thank you for your stellar review! I am glad to hear your boots continue to bring lasting comfortability, and they work well for your day to day. We hope to continue to serve you.

name: Clara Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
This is my third Kask Utopia helmet (first was white; second orange crashed; third replaced the crashed orange). Really liked the fit and semi-aero design of the Utopia. But the second Orange has a Major color Fade!! No longer bright orange but mostly a muted yellow. Not cool.
The bright orange was a perfect match with my Dogma F12 and our club kit -- but no longer. 

If you like the Orange, give this one a second thought. 
Perhaps other companies won't color fade?
review.name: Great but Major Color Fade

review.reviewBody:
Slip stream what?
Very comfy and very nice.
Sleek stealth and al that I need in Matte Black.
review.name: Sleek Alien Tech

review.reviewBody: This is the best fitting helmet I have ever worn. The dial automatically adjusts, and fits both oval and round shapes.  The only issue I have with the helmet is that the plastic parts of the retention system have sharp edges.  I had to file them down a bit to smooth them out.
review.name: Best fit system with sharp retention

review.reviewBody: If you have a normal shaped head, this helmet won't work for you. I have a lot of hair, so always have to go with larger helmets to accommodate my hair and the cap I wear underneath. I own two other Kask  Protone and POC Ventral Airspin, which are all great. This Kask Utopia has the oddest shape. If your head is like a long oval, this helmet will probably be a match made in heaven for you. There are two thin narrow padded strips that come forward, running vertically at the front of the helmet. They rest against your forehead. After a long ride, I had semi-permanent marks from these strips. They eventually went away after a few hours. When I tried to adjust the helmet a bit more to avoid this irritation, the helmet was too loose. I love the Kask brand, but this Utopia was a big "No" for me! Unfortunately, since I wore it once- I wasn't able to return it where I purchased on sale from Excel Sports in CO. Be mindful of purchasing from them for this reason. Most places will at least give you a credit if you're unhappy with the product.
review.name: This helmet is awful for me!!
comment: Why are you giving a one-star review related to personal anatomy and an irrelevant vendor?  Do you not know how this works, Karen?

Same here! Want to like it, but have the same experience. Any ride over an hour and those front pads are just killing my forehead. Bad enough where I have to loosen it all the way up when I stop at traffic lights and retighten when I start going again. Takes hours for the head dents to go away after. Too bad, otherwise a really nice helmet.

review.reviewBody: I crashed at about 28mph and landed on the back on my head and back after going over the handlebars (long story). This helmet literally saved my life; not even a concussion. The helmet is destroyed. I bought another Utopia because of my experience. It may be that I was lucky, which is most likely, but my head survived from the helmet.
review.name: Post crash
comment:
Hello Chris. Looks like you hit the concrete pretty hard. I'm glad you are here to tell about it. I can definitely relate to that. I also hit the concrete side/head first violently and had a concussion this summer at 4:30am at the trail. If I passed out, only God knows. Since there wasn't a single soul around to confirm. Yes, the mojito saved my life. Used to ride around in circles without it sometimes, never again. Without that helmet, would have definitely cracked my skull and... Ended up with a broken hand also. 

It was my first concussion and 6 months later, I still get the imbalance when I get up from a horizontal position. Just stopped by here today bc Santa is paying for another helmet

name: Utopia Helmet
